summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Internal.AmazonAccountEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon Account endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for Account service requests. Collects values for AccountEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses AccountEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteAlternateContact operation. Deletes the specified alternate contact from an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.
Before you can update the alternate contact information for an Amazon Web Services account that is managed by Organizations, you must first enable integration between Amazon Web Services Account Management and Organizations. For more information, see Enabling trusted access for Amazon Web Services Account Management.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest.AlternateContactType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AlternateContactType.
Specifies which of the alternate contacts to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteAlternateContact operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.DisableRegionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DisableRegion operation. Disables (opts-out) a particular Region for an account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.DisableRegionRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must also be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.DisableRegionRequest.RegionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegionName.
Specifies the Region-code for a given Region name (for example, af-south-1). When you disable a Region, Amazon Web Services performs actions to deactivate that Region in your account, such as destroying IAM resources in the Region. This process takes a few minutes for most accounts, but this can take several hours. You cannot enable the Region until the disabling process is fully completed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.DisableRegionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DisableRegion operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.EnableRegionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the EnableRegion operation. Enables (opts-in) a particular Region for an account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.EnableRegionRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must also be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.EnableRegionRequest.RegionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegionName.
Specifies the Region-code for a given Region name (for example, af-south-1). When you enable a Region, Amazon Web Services performs actions to prepare your account in that Region, such as distributing your IAM resources to the Region. This process takes a few minutes for most accounts, but it can take several hours. You cannot use the Region until this process is complete. Furthermore, you cannot disable the Region until the enabling process is fully completed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.EnableRegionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the EnableRegion operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListRegions operation. Lists all the Regions for a given account and their respective opt-in statuses. Optionally, this list can be filtered by the region-opt-status-contains parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must also be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The total number of items to return in the commands output. If the total number of items available is more than the value specified, a NextToken is provided in the commands output. To resume pagination, provide the NextToken value in the starting-token argument of a subsequent command. Do not use the NextToken response element directly outside of the Amazon Web Services CLI. For usage examples, see Pagination in the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token used to specify where to start paginating. This is the NextToken from a previously truncated response. For usage examples, see Pagination in the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsRequest.RegionOptStatusContains
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RegionOptStatusContains.
A list of Region statuses (Enabling, Enabled, Disabling, Disabled, Enabled_by_default) to use to filter the list of Regions for a given account. For example, passing in a value of ENABLING will only return a list of Regions with a Region status of ENABLING.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListRegions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If there is more data to be returned, this will be populated. It should be passed into the next-token request parameter of list-regions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.ListRegionsResponse.Regions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Regions.
This is a list of Regions for a given account, or if the filtered parameter was used, a list of Regions that match the filter criteria set in the filter parameter.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutAlternateContact operation. Modifies the specified alternate contact attached to an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.
Before you can update the alternate contact information for an Amazon Web Services account that is managed by Organizations, you must first enable integration between Amazon Web Services Account Management and Organizations. For more information, see Enabling trusted access for Amazon Web Services Account Management.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId; it must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.AlternateContactType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AlternateContactType.
Specifies which alternate contact you want to create or update.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.EmailAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmailAddress.
Specifies an email address for the alternate contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies a name for the alternate contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.PhoneNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PhoneNumber.
Specifies a phone number for the alternate contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactRequest.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
Specifies a title for the alternate contact.

member.name: T:Amazon.Account.Model.PutAlternateContactResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutAlternateContact operation.

For complete details about how to use the primary contact operations, see Update the primary and alternate contact information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutContactInformationRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Specifies the 12-digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to access or modify with this operation. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web Services account of the identity used to call the operation. To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the organization's management account or a delegated administrator account. The specified account ID must also be a member account in the same organization. The organization must have all features enabled, and the organization must have trusted access enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a delegated admin account assigned.
The management account can't specify its own AccountId. It must call the operation in standalone context by not including the AccountId parameter.
To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an organization, don't specify this parameter. Instead, call the operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts you wish to retrieve or modify.

member.name: P:Amazon.Account.Model.PutContactInformationRequest.ContactInformation

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAccountClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Account.AmazonAccountClient.DeleteAlternateContactAsync(Amazon.Account.Model.DeleteAlternateContactRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Deletes the specified alternate contact from an Amazon Web Services account.
For complete details about how to use the alternate contact operations, see Access or updating the alternate contacts.
Before you can update the alternate contact information for an Amazon Web Services account that is managed by Organizations, you must first enable integration between Amazon Web Services Account Management and Organizations. For more information, see Enabling trusted access for Amazon Web Services Account Management.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteAlternateContact service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteAlternateContact service method, as returned by Account.
member.exception: The operation failed because the calling identity doesn't have the minimum required permissions.
The operation failed because of an error internal to Amazon Web Services. Try your operation again later.
The operation failed because it specified a resource that can't be found.
The operation failed because it was called too frequently and exceeded a throttle limit.
The operation failed because one of the input parameters was invalid.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteAlternateContact Operation
